newsitem.title: UK: UK's Major wants stronger ties with Latin America.
newsitem.headline: UK's Major wants stronger ties with Latin America.

text.p: Prime Minister John Major said on Monday Britain wanted to deepen its political and business ties with Latin America and work together to combat drugs trafficking, terrorism and international crime.

Major told a conference aimed at boosting investment and trade flows between Britain and Latin America: "Britain and Latin America need a modern relationship. A relationship that goes beyond bilateral trade and investment."
The conference is being attended by Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori, Brazilian President Frenando Henrique Cardoso and Panamanian President Perez Balladares.
Major said cooperation on international peacekeeping duties already showed what could be done.
"We must also strengthen our joint efforts to combat drug trafficking, international crime and terrorism. We must work together to solve the world's environmental problems," he added.
Major said Britain would continue to push for freer world trade and for the European Union to give greater access to Latin American states. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7768
